data.name: Reimplement destructuring assignment
data.description:
In JavaScript, we have a [destructuring assignment syntax](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/Destructuring_assignment) like this:

```javascript
let [a,{x:[b],c,...d},...e]=[1,{x:[2],c:3,d:4},5]
//here a=1,b=2,c=3,d={d:4},e=5
```

We will implement something similar to the destructuring assignment syntax, but we generate an object instead of assignment the values to variables, like this:

```
destructuring`[a,{x:[b],c,...d},...e]`([1,{x:[2],c:3,d:4},5])
//return {a:1,b:2,c:3,d:{d:4},e:[5]}
```

We also support default values, since we're using [tagged template string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Template_literals#Tagged_template_literals)

```
destructuring`[a=${1}]`([])
//return {a:1}
```

You can read [sections in ecma262 specification](https://tc39.github.io/ecma262/#sec-destructuring-assignment) and [sections in object rest/spread proposal](https://tc39.github.io/proposal-object-rest-spread/) for the syntax specification. But to be simple, we only support simple identifiers as assign target, and we only use identifiers matched by `/[a-zA-Z_$][a-zA-Z0-9_$]*/`.Also, we only pass in the default values by `${}`, you should throw when `[a=1]` is used instead of `[a=${1}]`

The full syntax we support is listed below:

```
Pattern: ArrayPattern | ObjectPattern

ArrayPattern: '[' Elision? RestElement? ']' | '[' ElementList ']' | '[' ElementList ',' Elision? RestElement? ']'
ElementList: ElisionElement | ElementList ',' ElisionElement
ElisionElement: Elision? Element
Element: Target Initializer?
RestElement: '...' Target
Elision: /,+/

ObjectPattern: '{' RestProperty? '}' | '{' PropertyList '}' | '{' PropertyList ',' RestProperty? '}'
PropertyList: Property | PropertyList ',' Property
Property: Target Initializer? | Name ':' Element
RestProperty: '...' Target

Target: Name | Pattern
Name: /[a-zA-Z_$][a-zA-Z0-9_$]*/
Initializer: '=' Value
Value: //something in the ${}
```

You should omit spaces just like what JavaScript do

You should throw for any syntax error. You should also throw for any thing that is not unpackable.

```
destructuring`{a==1}`//throws
destructuring`[a=${1}]`(1)//throws
```

Note:
- We do not test special names like `__proto__`, so you can use normal plain object as map.
- In fact, ArrayPattern matches and only matches everything iterable. 
- Since iterator may throw, you should throw if and only if it throws when you are extracting the element you need. 
- In real javascript, iterator used by array destructuring assignment will be closed after used, but here we do not test it.
- ObjectPattern do not match null and undefined, you should throw.
- In ObjectPattern you can assign variable from not own or not enumerable property, but rest destructuring act just like `Object.assign`
- When one name is assigned multiple times, use the right-most one. 
- Node.js do not support object rest/spread properties before 8.6.0, this means you can not use it currently in codewars.
